juzzyPython.generic.Input module

Input.py Created 18/12/2021

class juzzyPython.generic.Input.Input(name: str, domain: juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple, x: Optional[float] = None, inputMF: Optional[juzzyPython.generic.MF_Interface.MF_Interface] = None)[source]

Bases: object

Class Input: The Input class allows the management and updating of one input, for example as part of fuzzy membership functions.

Parameters

  • name – The name of the input

  • domain – the range of the input

  • x – Current input value

  • inputMF – the input membership object

Functions:

class juzzyPython.generic.Output.Output(name: str, domain: juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple, discretisationLevel: Optional[int] = None)[source]

Bases: object

Class Output: Enables the labeling of an output and captures the allowable domain for a given output.

Parameters

  • output (name = name of) –

  • = (discretisationLevel) –

  • = –

Functions:

getName setName getDiscretisationLevel setDiscretisationLevel getDomain setDomain getDiscretisations

getDiscretisationLevel() → int[source]

Get the current discretisation level

getDiscretisations() → List[float][source]

Returns an array with discrete values over the domain of this output. This discrete array is buffered in the Output object, i.e. if the same discretisation is kept, it is efficient to use the array from the output object (e.g. in rule-based inference).

getDomain() → juzzyPython.generic.Tuple.Tuple[source]

Get the current domain tuple

Return the name of the output
